alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 22 at 4:26AM EDT until June 22 at 9:11AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Big Bend Florida, including the following counties, Jefferson and Taylor. * WHEN...Until 730 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 426 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Perry, Hampton Springs, Perry-Foley Airport, Bucell Junction, Pinland, Foley, Adams Beach, Secotan, Athena, Fenholloway, Dekle Beach, Boyd, Jug Island, Jack Lee Island, Blue Springs, Keaton Beach, Cedar Island, Bird Island, Econfina and Carbur. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
